titleStmt.title: Q. S. Rousseau et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5227

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky your

Your petitioners would respectfully state that Term of the Metcalfe Circuit Court that there was an indictment found by the Grand Jury of sd County against Joseph. M. Clark for Horse Stealing now we would respectfully state that sd Clark is a man of family and very poor we make these statements hopeing that your Excellency will exercise the power vested in you and release sd Clark from sd Indictment

Q. S. Rousseau
N W. O. Newman
N James M. Horne
N Peter Cassadey
N Wm C. James
N John S. Dowell
N Robert. W. Dowell
N Richard H Dowell
N R. J. William
N J. D. Salmon
N Jes. G. Salmon
N C. W. Stephens
N Wm N. James
N G G. W. Wallace
N M D L mitchell
N Wm Pointer
N James M. Martin
N Marion Stephens
N Wm Poynter
N Shelby Stephens
N John Cassady
N Joseph Casady
N Alfred Tyler
N John. T. L. Boston
N A. B. Clarke
N Jos M asbury
N John M Stxton
N J. J. Martarn
N Wm. P martan
N William Jeffries
John.. Murry
Elice... William
N G Wallace
N Jack Poynter
N Henry. H. Asbury
Albert. Sherly
N R. E. Hinds
The names marked N were living within three or four miles of J M Clarkes ^ residence ^ when charged and indicted for horse stealing Respectfully

W. O. Newman
Post Master
Rockland Mills Ky
M. P. William
Metcalfe Cir Ct
vs
Jos. M. Ckark
Refused
